page.syntax: Position as N = RAT(C substring,C string[,N occurance])

argument.name: string
argument.description: The character string to examine for occurrences of Find_String.

argument.name: occurance
argument.description: Optional. Default (1). The instance of the Find_String to find. Numeric

page.description: Returns the position of one string found in another, relative from the end of the string.
page.discussion: The RAT() function searches backwards through the Search_In_String looking for the n th occurrence of the Find_String ; where n is specified through the Number argument. If the Find_String is found, then RAT returns its Position, a numeric value that equals the number of characters from the end of the Search_In_String at which the Find_String starts. If no match is found, RAT returns 0. Number is an optional argument, and if omitted the first occurrence of the Find_String will be returned. The Find_String argument is case sensitive.
page.example: ? rat("word", "word1 word2 word3", 1) = 5 ? rat("word", "word1 word2 word3", 2) = 11 ? rat("word", "word1 word2 word3", 3) = 17 ? rat("word", "word1 word2 word3", 4) = 0 ? rat("O'Neill", "Timothy P. O'Neill") = 7 ? rat("case", "CaSe SeNsItIve") = 0
